rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The confidence value of expertise in the review topic given by the reviwer.

0 on a [-2,2] scale (Discrete -2 to 2 review rating scale)
number of demo paper accepted
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It indicates how many demo papers has been accepted for publication/presentation in the venue.
The CORE category for a conference for which no ranking decision has been made.

number of full paper accepted
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It indicates how many full papers has been accepted for publication/presentation in the venue.

Expert (Expert to Null reviewer confidence scale)
Weak Reject (Strong Reject to Strong Accept, without Borderline review rating scale)
3 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)

0 to 15 continuos review rating scale

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reviewer is quite sure, tried to check the important points carefully. It's unlikely, though conceivable, that he/she missed something that should affect his/her ratings.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 4 out of 5 (Discrete 1 to 5 review rating scale)
Strong Reject (Strong Reject to Strong Accept, without Borderline review rating scale)
10 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)

2 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)
has rating value

number of short paper accepted
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It indicates how many short papers has been accepted for publication/presentation in the venue.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reviewer is positive that the evaluation is correct, has read the paper very carefully and is familiar with related work.

Null (Expert to Null reviewer confidence scale)

academic event
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any academic event such as conferences, workshops, symposia.

Strong Accept (Strong Reject to Strong Accept review rating scale)
BiDO-Review-Measures
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The need of describing aspects related to the review process is an important aspect to address by publishers (e.g., Springer) for keeping track of crucial information about conferences and journals. In addition, these data can be crucial for assessing the quality of the venues where researchers publish papers.
This module of BiDO describes a list of possible reviews measures tha can be used to define bibliometric data of scholarly venues such as conferences, workshops, and journals.
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Silvio Peroni
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The BiDO Review Measures module (BiDO-Review-Measures) describes a list of possible reviews measures that can be used to define bibliometric data of scholarly venues such as conferences, workshops, journals.
**URL:** http://purl.org/spar/bido-review-measures
**Creators**: [Silvio Peroni](http://orcid.org/0000-0003-0530-4305), [Idafen Santana-Pérez](https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8296-8629), [María Poveda-Villalón](https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3587-0367)
**Contributors**: [Aliaksandr Birukou](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4925-9131)
**License:** [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode)
**Website:** http://www.sparontologies.net/ontologies/bido
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Idafen Santana-Pérez
rdf:Description.dc:title: BiDO Review Measures module (BiDO-Review-Measures)
rdf:Description.dc:creator: María Poveda-Villalón

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The CORE category for other ranked conference venues that meet minimum standards.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: C

Accept (Accept to Reject, Two Strikes review rating scale)
0 out of 5 (Discrete 0 to 5 review rating scale)
6 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A discrete scale defining the rating given by a reviewer for a specific scientific contribution.

8 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)
Not approved (Approved to Not Approved review rating scale)
2 on a [-2,2] scale (Discrete -2 to 2 review rating scale)
peer review type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class describes different kinds of peer review processes, such as double-blind and open.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 9 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)
5 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reviewer is pretty sure, but there's a chance he/she missed something. Although she/he has a good feel for this area in general, she/he did not carefully check the paper's details, e.g., the math, experimental design, or novelty.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 3 out of 5 (Discrete 1 to 5 review rating scale)
Approved with reservations (Approved to Not Approved review rating scale)
B
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The CORE category for a good conference, and well regarded in a discipline area.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 7 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Discrete scale from Strong Reject to Strong Accept, including Bordeline
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Strong Reject to Strong Accept review rating scale
4 out of 5 (Discrete 0 to 5 review rating scale)
4 out of 10 (Discrete 0 to 10 review rating scale)
Low (Expert to Null reviewer confidence scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Not reviewer's area of expertise, or paper is very hard to understand. The evaluation is just an educated guess.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 1 out of 5 (Discrete 1 to 5 review rating scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: EasyChair is a conference management system that is flexible, easy to use, and has many features to make it suitable for various conference models. It is currently probably the most commonly used conference management system.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EasyChair

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It identifies all the review processes where the identity of the reviewers is concealed from the authors.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: single blind peer review
Weak Accept (Strong Reject to Strong Accept, without Borderline review rating scale)
reviewer confidence scale
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A scale defining the confidence of a reviewer for a given topic.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is defined in ranking
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It links a ranking category with the ranking that defines it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A*
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The CORE category for a flagship conference, a leading venue in a discipline area.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 1 out of 5 (Discrete 0 to 5 review rating scale)
2 out of 5 (Discrete 1 to 5 review rating scale)
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reviewers is willing to defend my evaluation, but it is fairly likely that he/she missed some details, didn't understand some central points, or can't be sure about the novelty of the work.
This class describes conference rankings as composed by categories identifying different rankings.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: conference ranking

reviewer confidence value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class describes the set of values compliant with a given reviewer confidence scale.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Minor revision (Accept to Reject, Two Strikes review rating scale)
review rating scale
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A scale defining the rating given by a reviewer for a specific scientific contribution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Medium (Expert to Null reviewer confidence scale)
0 to 10 continuos review rating scale

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The CORE Conference Ranking (http://www.core.edu.au/index.php/conference-rankings) is an ongoing activity that provides assessments of major conferences in the computing disciplines.The rankings are managed by the CORE Executive Committee, with updates processed from time to time by a subcommittee established as needed.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CORE conference ranking
open peer review
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It identifies all the review processes where the identity of the authors and the reviewers is known.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Borderline (Strong Reject to Strong Accept review rating scale)

Reject (Strong Reject to Strong Accept, without Borderline review rating scale)
Accept to Reject, Two Strikes review rating scale
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Discrete scale from Accept to Reject, including pre-screening and two strikes rule

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: number of external reviewers involved
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It indicates how many external reviewers have been involved in the reviewing phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Conference Management Toolkit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Conference Management Toolkit (CMT) is a free conference management service sponsored by Microsoft Research.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: -1 on a [-2,2] scale (Discrete -2 to 2 review rating scale)
review rating value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class describes the set of values compliant with a given review rating scale.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: 3 out of 5 (Discrete 0 to 5 review rating scale)
High (Expert to Null reviewer confidence scale)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any possible work such as journals, magazines, books, etc., created for scientific purposes and possibily related with review processes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It identifies all the review processes where the identity of the authors is concealed from the reviewers, and vice versa.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: double blind peer review

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It links a ranking category with one that is less important.
This class describes all the possible venue management systems (such as conference management systems and journal management systems) that can be used for managing scholarly venues.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: scholarly venue management system
